page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block is immediately north-east of Newark-on-Trent in Nottinghamshire. It contains parts of the town of Newark in its south-western corner, together with the near by villages of Coddington and Winthorpe. The area lies in the valley of the River Trent,approximately 20 miles north-east of Nottingham . The A.1 trunk{road}crosses the{river}here,and the A.46.(Fosse Way)and A.17.roads both pass through the block as they converge on Newark.The main East Coast {railway}line from London (King's Cross)to Edinburg traverses the western section of the block.This is predominantly an agricultural area,with some{industry}in the squares which cover Newark,and some gravel extraction alongside the River Trent.
